trans-unit.source: description: Through the Windows.ApplicationModel.Contacts namespace, you have several options for selecting contacts.
trans-unit.target: description: Through the Windows.ApplicationModel.Contacts namespace, you have several options for selecting contacts.

trans-unit.source: Select contacts
trans-unit.target: Select contacts

trans-unit.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)

trans-unit.source: Through the [**Windows.ApplicationModel.Contacts**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR225002) namespace, you have several options for selecting contacts.
trans-unit.target: Through the [**Windows.ApplicationModel.Contacts**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR225002) namespace, you have several options for selecting contacts.

trans-unit.source: Here, we'll show you how to select a single contact or multiple contacts, and we'll show you how to configure the contact picker to retrieve only the contact information that your app needs.
trans-unit.target: Here, we'll show you how to select a single contact or multiple contacts, and we'll show you how to configure the contact picker to retrieve only the contact information that your app needs.

trans-unit.source: Set up the contact picker
trans-unit.target: Set up the contact picker

trans-unit.source: Create an instance of [**Windows.ApplicationModel.Contacts.ContactPicker**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR224913) and assign it to a variable.
trans-unit.target: Create an instance of [**Windows.ApplicationModel.Contacts.ContactPicker**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR224913) and assign it to a variable.

trans-unit.source: Set the selection mode (optional)
trans-unit.target: Set the selection mode (optional)

trans-unit.source: By default, the contact picker retrieves all of the available data for the contacts that the user selects.
trans-unit.target: By default, the contact picker retrieves all of the available data for the contacts that the user selects.

trans-unit.source: The [**SelectionMode**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR224913-selectionmode) property lets you configure the contact picker to retrieve only the data fields that your app needs.
trans-unit.target: The [**SelectionMode**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR224913-selectionmode) property lets you configure the contact picker to retrieve only the data fields that your app needs.

trans-unit.source: This is a more efficient way to use the contact picker if you only need a subset of the available contact data.
trans-unit.target: This is a more efficient way to use the contact picker if you only need a subset of the available contact data.

trans-unit.source: First, set the [**SelectionMode**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR224913-selectionmode) property to **Fields**:
trans-unit.target: First, set the [**SelectionMode**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR224913-selectionmode) property to **Fields**:

trans-unit.source: Then, use the [**desiredFieldsWithContactFieldType**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR224913-desiredfieldswithcontactfieldtype) property to specify the fields that you want the contact picker to retrieve.
trans-unit.target: Then, use the [**desiredFieldsWithContactFieldType**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR224913-desiredfieldswithcontactfieldtype) property to specify the fields that you want the contact picker to retrieve.

trans-unit.source: This example configures the contact picker to retrieve email addresses:
trans-unit.target: This example configures the contact picker to retrieve email addresses:

trans-unit.source: Launch the picker
trans-unit.target: Launch the picker

trans-unit.source: Use [**pickContactsAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR224913-pickcontactsasync) if you want the user to select one or more contacts.
trans-unit.target: Use [**pickContactsAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR224913-pickcontactsasync) if you want the user to select one or more contacts.

trans-unit.source: Process the contacts
trans-unit.target: Process the contacts

trans-unit.source: When the picker returns, check whether the user has selected any contacts.
trans-unit.target: When the picker returns, check whether the user has selected any contacts.

trans-unit.source: If so, process the contact information.
trans-unit.target: If so, process the contact information.

trans-unit.source: This example shows how to processes a single contact.
trans-unit.target: This example shows how to processes a single contact.

trans-unit.source: Here we retrieve the contact's name and copy it into a [**TextBlock**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR209652) control called *OutputName*.
trans-unit.target: Here we retrieve the contact's name and copy it into a [**TextBlock**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR209652) control called *OutputName*.

trans-unit.source: This example shows how to process multiple contacts.
trans-unit.target: This example shows how to process multiple contacts.

trans-unit.source: Complete example (single contact)
trans-unit.target: Complete example (single contact)

trans-unit.source: This example uses the contact picker to retrieve a single contact's name along with an email address, location or phone number.
trans-unit.target: This example uses the contact picker to retrieve a single contact's name along with an email address, location or phone number.

trans-unit.source: Complete example (multiple contacts)
trans-unit.target: Complete example (multiple contacts)

trans-unit.source: This example uses the contact picker to retrieve multiple contacts and then adds the contacts to a [**ListView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR242878) control called `OutputContacts`.
trans-unit.target: This example uses the contact picker to retrieve multiple contacts and then adds the contacts to a [**ListView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR242878) control called `OutputContacts`.

trans-unit.source: Summary and next steps
trans-unit.target: Summary and next steps

trans-unit.source: Now you have a basic understanding of how to use the contact picker to retrieve contact information.
trans-unit.target: Now you have a basic understanding of how to use the contact picker to retrieve contact information.

trans-unit.source: Download the [Universal Windows app samples](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619979) from GitHub to see more examples of how to use contacts and the contact picker.
trans-unit.target: Download the [Universal Windows app samples](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619979) from GitHub to see more examples of how to use contacts and the contact picker.
